p: The obtained fluorescent signal of the GFP conidia is a clear indication of the viability of the cells when encapsulated in the oil phase of the silica-NH 2 Pickering emulsions. The conidia in the emulsions remained viable for three weeks. The viability of the Metarhizium conidia cells while encapsulated in the silica-NH 2 Pickering emulsions was further characterized by culturing the conidia on a Sabouraud Dextrose Agar (SDA) growth medium (see Materials and Methods). The germination percentages of the encapsulated conidia were 85 ± 8.3%, demonstrating their viability and their ability to germinate. The control system (without emulsion) had germination percentages of 95 ± 5%.
